context.text: United States House of Representatives elections, 1978 - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
District Incumbent Party Elected Status Opponent
United States House of Representatives elections, 1978
Key to color code: Blue=Democratic pickup; Red=Republican pickup.
Key to party abbreviations: AI=American Independent, D=Democrat, PF=Peace and Freedom, R=Republican.
96th United States Congress United States Senate elections, 1978
Future president George W. Bush was the Republican nominee for a seat in Texas, but lost.

Notable freshmen included future Vice President Dick Cheney (R-Wy.), future Speaker Newt Gingrich (R-Ga.), future Senate Majority Leader Tom Daschle (D-S.D.), and future U.S. Senator Olympia J. Snowe (R-Me.).

The U.S. House election, 1978 was an election for the United States House of Representatives in 1978 which occurred in the middle of President Jimmy Carter 's term. The country was going through an energy crisis and was still suffering from rapid inflation and as in many midterm elections, the President's Democratic Party lost seats to the opposition Republican Party , in this case a net of 15, but the Democrats still retained a rather large majority.
United States House of Representatives elections, 1978
